author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump says he asked 'to slow testing down' for coronavirus because of increased cases
description: On coronavirus testing, President Trump called it a ‘double edged sword’ and asked his officials to ““slow the testing down, please." Dr. Kavita Patel says for half of the country, “We’re still doing the same number of tests and we’re still finding a higher d…

author: MSNBC.com
title: Celeb org “More Than a Vote” promotes black voter empowerment
description: “More Than a Vote”--an organization featuring prominent athletes and other stars, including LeBron James--is actively working to support black voter turnout. “More Than a Vote” member, retired NBA player Kendrick Perkins, joins Joy Reid to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: No social distancing, many seen not wearing masks at Trump Tulsa rally
description: As President Trump began his rally in Tulsa, Nicolle Wallace says, “If you look at all those videos from inside, there are not a lot of mask wearers inside.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Activist speaks on her viral video analogy for systemic racism
description: The Tulsa Race Riots, similar events in history targeting black Americans, and reparations are discussed by viral video star Kimberly Latrice Jones, an activist who spoke out with a powerful analogy for systemic racism.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Analysis: Berman resigned knowing deputy will continue probes

source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Historian calls Trump Tulsa rally a ‘psychological calculation’
description: Donald Trump’s Tulsa rally witnessed Black Lives Matter protesters apparently being separated from the entrance to the rally, with at least one peaceful protester being forcibly removed. Joy Reid takes you live to the opening of the president’s rally amid the…

author: MSNBC.com
title: Steve Schmidt calls Trump’s rally ‘a speech George Wallace could have given in 1968’

author: MSNBC.com
title: Eddie Glaude: Trump’s rally had ‘fear mongering at every level, race baiting’
description: Princeton Professor Eddie Glaude says that Trump’s rally “There was fear mongering at every level, race baiting, ‘the Chinese virus, kung-flu.’ It was just simply a kind of desperation, rooted in the most hateful language.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: The Horrors of 2020

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sharpton: The Black community is 'still struggling toward full and equal protection under the law'
description: In his final thoughts, Rev. Al Sharpton acknowledges the tenacity of the Black community and encourages the community to push forward in the fight for equality.

source.name: MSNBC

title: Tulsa resident on Trump: 'This president is for a country that is not inclusive of everyone'

title: White House denies, deflects small crowd at Trump comeback campaign rally
description: President Trump kicked off his first campaign-style rally since March with a crowd size nowhere near what was expected. The White House blames protesters outside the arena for blocking the rally-goers from getting in.
content: NBC News: President Trump is "furious" at the "underwhelming" crowd at his rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, on Saturday evening, according to multiple people close to the White House.
